page.title: 08SAND BAY
page.content: The sand comes over into people's gardens about twice a year. Cars and bicycles sometimes slide about and get stuck when the sand heaps onto the road. The sand on the beach is hard to sit on and hard to walk on and all the pebbles get in your shoes and hurt your feet. On Sand Point the wind is wild and often cold even in summer. It whistles and wails blowing bushes and trees. The waves pound the rocks driven by the wind. Spray hits your face at high tide as wind swerves through your feet trying to knock you down. To walk on windy Sand Point you have to be bold as the wind is never mild.
